oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of Sidney Montagu to Sir Edward Montagu
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Montagu, Sidney
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Theater--England--London--History--17th century
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Montagus were a family with roots in Northamptonshire. Edward Montagu (1563-1644) carried the title first Baron Montagu; Sir Charles was his younger brother. Sidney Montagu (d. 1644) was a member and bencher of the Middle Temple who served as master of Requests. In this letter, Sidney writes to Edward describing the fireworks and "sea battle" staged for the wedding of Princess Elizabeth to Frederick, Count Palatine.
